meanings.def: a person whose job is to take care of sick or injured people, usually in a hospital
examples: a registered nurse
a qualified/trained nurse
She trained as a nurse in Korea.
student nurses
a male nurse
a dental nurse (= one who helps a dentist)
a psychiatric nurse (= one who works in a hospital for people with mental illnesses)
a team of doctors and nurses
a nurses' station (= an office for nurses in a hospital)
Nurse Bennett
Nurse, come quickly!
I work as a nurse in a busy hospital.
The country faces a growing shortage of nurses.
The school nurse provides excellent first aid.
She led them to a nurses' station and consulted with the sister
He went to the South Bank University to become a qualified nurse.

meanings.def: (in the past) a woman or girl whose job was to take care of babies or small children in their own homes
to care for somebody who is ill or injured
examples: He worked in a hospital for ten years nursing cancer patients.
She nursed her daughter back to health.
She nursed her husband devotedly through his last illness.
He was nursed back to health by his devoted servant.

meanings.def: to take care of an injury or illness, especially by resting and not trying to do too much
examples: Several weeks after the match, he was still nursing a shoulder injury.
You'd better go to bed and nurse that cold.
(figurative) She was nursing her hurt pride.
(figurative) European markets were still nursing their wounds after Monday's losses.
I'm nursing a mild hangover from last night's party.
She's still nursing a broken heart at the sudden break-up of her marriage.

meanings.def: to have a strong feeling or idea in your mind for a long time
examples: to nurse an ambition/a grievance/a grudge
She had been nursing a secret desire to see him again.

meanings.def: to give special care or attention to somebody/something
examples: to nurse tender young plants
He nursed the car up the steep hill.

meanings.def: to hold a drink for a long time, drinking it slowly
examples: He sat nursing his cup of coffee.

meanings.def: to feed a baby with milk from the breast
examples: a nursing mother
nurse somebody/something The lioness is still nursing her cubs.

meanings.def: to drink milk from its mother’s breast
examples: Babies nurse more at night in the first three weeks.
